articles.description: When Africa seems once again to be "forgotten," China comes to the continent of hope and continues to make Africa the starting point of its annual diplomacy, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told media after concluding his Africa visit, continuing a 36-year t…

articles.title: Singapore Data Center Market Investment Analysis Report 2026-2031: Opportunities in IT, Electrical, and Mechanical Infrastructure, Cooling Systems, Construction and Tier Standards
articles.description: The Singapore Data Center Market is set to grow from USD 3.25 billion in 2025 to USD 5.11 billion by 2031, with a CAGR of 7.83%. As a key data hub in Southeast Asia, Singapore aims to balance rapid expansion with sustainability goals, targeting net-zero emiss…

articles.title: Global experts assembled in Kolkata to advance precision oncology at GCC - EZOS 2026
articles.description: Global leaders in cancer care convened in Kolkata for the GCC-EZOS 2026 conference, focusing on advancing personalized diagnosis, treatment, and prevention. The event showcased breakthroughs in genomics, AI, and immunotherapy, aiming to translate innovation i…

articles.title: Fed's loss of independence would push up inflation - Rehn
articles.description: Any loss of US Federal Reserve independence would push up inflation and might even endanger financial stability, Finnish central bank Governor Olli Rehn said today as he expressed "full solidarity" with Fed Chair Jerome Powell.

California's stock market billionaires are angrily denouncing a proposed tax to fund healthcare for the millions of illegal migrants they welcomed into their state.

articles.title: Eilat port 'almost completely paralyzed' due to Yemen's pro-Palestinian operations: Reports
articles.description: The port of Eilat in the southernmost tip of the occupied territories has seen its revenues fall to "nearly zero" due to Yemeni pro-Palestinian operations disrupting Red Sea shipping lanes, Israeli media report.

articles.title: Multi-billion-pound drive to transform rail and growth across Yorkshire and North East
articles.description: Northern Powerhouse Rail plans announced to grow productivity, with faster rail commutes across Yorkshire, better journeys to the North East and route upgrades.

articles.description: Third-quarter GDP growth in the Philippines fell to a four-year low of 4%, prompting Manila to slash growth targets for 2026 through 2028.

articles.title: The death toll from a crackdown on protests in Iran jumps to over 2,500, activists say
articles.description: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran has surpassed 2,500, activists said, as Iranians made phone calls abroad for the first time in days Tuesday.

articles.description: Vice President Gibran Rakabuming Raka visited the Potikelek Traditional Market in Wamena, Jayawijaya District, to ensure the economy of the indigenous Papuan ...

articles.title: U.S. Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slip in early morning trade. Key factors to watch out on Wednesday
articles.description: Wall Street analysts expect companies in the S&P 500 index will deliver earnings per share for the final three months of 2025 that are 8.3 per cent higher than a year earlier.

articles.description: Here's what actually makes a password strong, and when long passwords can still fail.

articles.title: Texas, others make NIL sailing rough for Alabama football | Goodbread
articles.description: Thanks to the likes of Texas, Ohio State and others, the NIL and transfer portal era can make for rough sailing for Alabama football.

articles.title: Amy Schumer buys a Manhattan apartment for $6.25 million, then officially files for ‘amicable’ divorce from Chris Fischer
articles.description: Comedian Amy Schumer has officially filed for divorce from her husband, Chris Fischer, one month after she confirmed that the duo had split.

articles.title: Musk's xAI disables Grok's ability to create sexualized images of real people after backlash
articles.description: X's safety account said in a social media post that no users will be able to create sexualized images of real people using Grok.

articles.title: Why oil experts say U.S.-Iran tensions feel different this time around than previous crises
articles.description: Oil experts are factoring in the possibility of revolutionary upheaval in Iran as tensions with the U.S. flare back up.

articles.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer parsed Wednesday's session.

articles.title: Down in the polls, Trump yanks Republicans toward economic populism. It may not save them
articles.description: President Donald Trump phoned Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren earlier this week.

articles.title: Verizon’s outage may have annoyed users, but it didn’t bother investors
articles.description: Verizon’s stock rose Wednesday, despite reports of widespread outages of the company’s wireless service.

articles.title: Your wealth and investments would be on the line if Trump torpedoes the Fed’s independence
articles.description: When politicians get involved with central-bank decisions, inflation, the dollar and the stock market all become less predictable.

articles.title: Oil falls nearly 2% after Trump signals he could hold off on attacking Iran
articles.description: Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that "we've been told that the killing in Iran is stopping. It's stopped. It's stopping, and there's no plan for executions."

articles.title: 3 ways to invest in what could become a $200 billion market for humanoid robots
articles.description: Analysts see investment opportunities in makers of components, defense technology and critical minerals that will be vital to the future of robotics.

articles.title: Microsoft’s stock may be an AI winner — but it’s not acting like one
articles.description: Morgan Stanley says the stock looks “well underpriced” in part due to heavy corporate enthusiasm for the company’s AI offerings.

articles.title: China's ban on cybersecurity software roils three of our stocks — here's our view
articles.description: Chinese authorities have told domestic companies to stop using software from a handful of U.S. and Israeli firms.

articles.title: Businesses across the U.S. are beginning to pass tariff costs to consumers, Fed’s ‘beige book’ finds
articles.description: Only two of a dozen Fed districts reported slight price growth. The rest saw higher costs.

articles.title: How Trump’s affordability push is prompting Wall Street to rethink what’s next for tariffs
articles.description: Doubts have begun to emerge on Wall Street about how current tariff levels fit with the Trump administration’s new affordability push.

articles.title: Financial stocks have another rough day, while two sectors buck market slump
articles.description: Every weekday, the Investing Club releases the Homestretch; an actionable afternoon update just in time for the last hour of trading.

articles.title: The wait for a tariff ruling could signal a Trump win — or a refund headache
articles.description: The likelihood of the Supreme Court ruling in favor of President Donald Trump in a closely watched tariff case increased moderately Wednesday after the court again held off on releasing its decision.

articles.title: LIVE: Officials from Denmark and Greenland hold news conference after U.S. talks
articles.description: Officials from Denmark and Greenland held a news conference after meeting with Trump administration officials.

articles.title: It took my boyfriend 10 years and $100K to get his degree. How can I tell him to get it together?
articles.description: If you aren’t both working toward similar goals, this relationship might not be viable over the long term.

articles.title: Google launches Personal Intelligence feature in Gemini app, challenging Apple Intelligence
articles.description: Google has been bolstering its AI offerings as it takes on OpenAI, and is now going directly at Apple.

articles.title: We're booking profits in a stock looking to cash in on a hot-yet-unprofitable investing craze
articles.description: We're peeling off some shares, which were bucking Wednesday's broader market decline.

articles.title: I’m just giving away jewelry when I die. Do I really need a will?
articles.description: It can seem like a lot of work to make decisions about giving away your worldly possessions.

articles.title: A Look At Duke Energy (DUK) Valuation As New Battery Storage Project Comes Online
articles.description: Duke Energy (DUK) recently activated a 50-megawatt battery storage system at its former Allen coal plant and is planning larger projects, while its stock currently trades at $118.68. The article presents two valuation perspectives: a narrative suggesting Duke Energy is 13% undervalued with a fair value of $136.35, and an SWS DCF model indicating it is overvalued with a fair value of US$64.38. The discrepancy highlights varying interpretations of future growth, regulatory stability, and cash flow projections for the utility company.

articles.title: Conning Inc. Sells 32,296 Shares of Genuine Parts Company $GPC
articles.description: Conning Inc. reduced its stake in Genuine Parts Company (NYSE:GPC) by 12.2% in the third quarter, selling 32,296 shares and holding 233,033 shares valued at $32.298 million. Despite this, Genuine Parts maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $148.00. The company recently declared a quarterly dividend of $1.03 per share and reported solid earnings, though it missed consensus EPS estimates for the last quarter.

articles.title: Bitcoin price rallies as BlackRock drives fresh inflows
articles.description: Bitcoin extended its gains, trading near $96,500 after a period of tight movement. This rally coincides with significant renewed inflows into US spot crypto ETFs, particularly BlackRock's IBIT and Fidelity's FBTC, indicating firming institutional demand. The market views bitcoin increasingly as a long-term macro asset, driven by concerns over currency debasement and stable macro conditions.

articles.title: International Paper: Global Shift to Sustainable Packaging
articles.description: International Paper is undergoing a significant transformation to become a global leader in sustainable packaging, driven by innovation, circular economy principles, and the strategic acquisition of DS Smith. The company is restructuring its operations, focusing on high-value packaging solutions, particularly in North America, and exiting less profitable ventures. Despite market challenges and a softer market predicted for 2025-2026, International Paper aims to achieve substantial financial targets by 2027 by focusing on customer experience, hyperlocal sales, and sustainable growth.

articles.title: TJX Companies Plans 35% Store Expansion Over 15 Years
articles.description: TJX Companies plans a significant expansion, aiming to increase its store count by 35% to 7,000 locations over the next 10 to 15 years, with a notable doubling of HomeGoods stores in the U.S. This aggressive growth strategy follows strong Q3 comparable store sales, exceeding analyst expectations, and demonstrates effective cost management leading to margin expansion. Analysts largely maintain positive outlooks for TJX, citing strong consumer trends and a promising macro environment for retail.

articles.title: TJX Companies: The Retail Stock That Actually Benefits From Tariffs and Inflation
articles.description: TJX Companies excels due to its off-price retail model, which thrives when traditional retailers struggle, benefiting from increased transaction volumes and basket sizes. Despite a premium valuation reflecting high expectations and past strong performance, the company has significant long-term growth potential by expanding its store base, especially its HomeGoods chain. While its model offers resilience during economic downturns, potential risks include its high valuation and the challenges of execution for aggressive expansion plans.

articles.title: Amcor stock reaches all-time high at 44.1 USD
articles.description: Amcor's stock has hit an all-time high of $44.10, despite a -2.84% 1-year price return, showing a 5.76% year-to-date gain and trading near its 52-week high of $52.25. The company maintains an attractive P/E ratio of 5.46, has raised its dividend for seven consecutive years, and reported strong Q1 fiscal year 2026 earnings, leading to an upgraded rating from Baird. However, Morgan Stanley adjusted its price target downward due to a mixed forecast.

articles.title: Genuine Parts Company: Steady Dividend Giant Faces Valuation Crossroads as Wall Street Turns Cautious
articles.description: Genuine Parts Company (GPC) is navigating a complex market, with its stock showing modest short-term gains but underperforming over the last year. While the company offers attractive dividends and resilient cash flows, analysts are cautious due to slower growth expectations and a valuation that reflects quality but limits upside. The market views GPC as a dependable, income-oriented holding rather than a growth vehicle, leading to a "Hold" consensus from Wall Street until clearer growth catalysts emerge or the valuation becomes more attractive.

articles.title: Rep. Julia Letlow Purchases Shares of Devon Energy Corporation (NYSE:DVN)
articles.description: Representative Julia Letlow (R-Louisiana) recently purchased between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Devon Energy Corporation (NYSE:DVN) stock on December 8th, 2025, as disclosed in a January 13th filing. The energy company, trading in the high $30s, pays a quarterly dividend of $0.24, yielding approximately 2.5% annually, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts. In the filing, Rep. Letlow also disclosed several other stock trades including sales of Salesforce and Pinterest, and purchases of United Rentals and Icon Energy.

articles.title: Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE:PRU) Receives Average Rating of "Hold" from Analysts
articles.description: Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE:PRU) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $118.80. Recent insider transactions show executives selling shares, with insiders now owning 0.25% of the company. Despite the "Hold" rating, Prudential Financial recently beat its quarterly EPS estimates and announced a quarterly dividend.

articles.title: Xcel cites growth pressures in electrical energy’s future
articles.description: Xcel Energy's President and CEO, Bob Frenzel, addressed growth pressures in the electrical energy sector, highlighting challenges posed by increasing demand from data centers, the need for a national initiative for nuclear power, and landowner resistance to new transmission lines. Frenzel emphasized protecting existing customers from the costs of large developments and advocated for nuclear power revitalization. He also stressed the importance of continued transmission line construction despite landowner hesitancy.

articles.title: VICI Properties Inc. (VICI) Ascends While Market Falls: Some Facts to Note
articles.description: VICI Properties Inc. (VICI) saw its stock price increase by 1.22% on the most recent trading day, outperforming the broader market despite recent monthly declines. The company is expected to announce its earnings on February 25, 2026, with anticipated growth in both EPS and revenue. VICI currently holds a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and has a Forward P/E ratio of 11.37 and a PEG ratio of 2.77.

articles.title: San Francisco-headquartered retailer shutters its only store in the city
articles.description: Williams Sonoma is closing its only San Francisco store in Union Square by the end of the month, marking the first time the company will not have a retail presence in its home city. Luxury fashion brand Chanel is expected to take over the space, having purchased the building in 2022 and planning extensive renovations. This comes amid other new retail openings and a bustling period for the Union Square shopping district.

articles.title: Is Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) Still Attractive After Its Strong Share Price Momentum
articles.description: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) has experienced significant share price momentum, with returns of 8.7% over the last 7 days and 108.7% over 5 years. While a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests the stock is undervalued by 45.3% compared to its intrinsic value of $110.36 per share, its current P/E ratio of 41.97x is above industry and peer averages, indicating it might be overvalued based on earnings multiples. The article encourages investors to use Simply Wall St's "Narratives" feature to form their own valuation based on individual assumptions and risk assessments.

articles.title: Equinor ASA: Energy Giant Balances Oil Cash Flows With Green Ambitions As The Stock Tests Investor P
articles.description: Equinor's stock has recently experienced a slight downturn, despite strong cash generation, as investors seek more clarity on how its energy transition strategy will drive growth and returns. The company is balancing its traditional oil and gas revenues with investments in low-carbon initiatives like offshore wind and carbon capture. While analysts remain cautiously optimistic with "Hold" ratings, the market is waiting for concrete financial evidence that these green ambitions will translate into profits before significantly re-rating the stock.

articles.title: Did BMO’s New Multi-Tranche Debt Issuance Just Shift Bank of Montreal's (TSX:BMO) Investment Narrative?
articles.description: Bank of Montreal recently issued multi-tranche debt, including senior and junior unsecured notes, which aligns with analyst expectations for improved net interest margins and efficiency. This move supports potential return-on-equity expansion for BMO, although risks like a sluggish Canadian economy and credit concerns could still impact loan growth. The debt issuance is seen as part of BMO's strategy to optimize its balance sheet and earnings mix.

articles.title: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) Rises As Market Takes a Dip: Key Facts
articles.description: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) saw its stock rise by 1.7% in the latest trading session, outperforming the S&P 500, Dow, and Nasdaq, which all experienced dips. Over the past month, FCX shares have appreciated by 24.82%, significantly exceeding the Basic Materials sector and S&P 500 gains. Analysts anticipate modest earnings growth for the full year and have recently become more positive on the stock, which currently holds a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold), indicating a favorable outlook.

articles.title: Why AXT (AXTI) Is Down 8.3% After Indium Phosphide Export Constraints and Capacity Expansion Plans - And What's Next
articles.description: AXT, Inc. recently announced updated Q4 2025 revenue expectations and discussed challenges with Chinese export permits for indium phosphide, which limited shipments despite strong demand. The company plans to significantly expand its indium phosphide capacity by H2 2026, funded by a December capital raise, to capitalize on AI-related data center infrastructure and high-speed optical connectivity. This strategy aims to address regulatory bottlenecks and leverage growing demand, while analysts have varying fair value estimates for the stock.

articles.title: Dollar General Stock: Discount Giant Tries To Regain Its Margin Mojo As Wall Street Turns Cautiously Optimistic
articles.description: Dollar General's stock is showing signs of stabilization after a challenging year, with investors cautiously optimistic about its potential for a durable turnaround. The company faces ongoing pressure from low-income consumers and margin concerns, but management's efforts to improve store operations, staffing, and inventory are being watched closely by Wall Street. While some analysts maintain a "Hold" rating, others see recovery potential, making it a critical period for Dollar General to regain investor trust through consistent execution.

articles.title: Matson (NYSE: MATX) Expects Q4 2025 Net Income to Reach $146.3 Million
articles.description: Matson (NYSE: MATX) anticipates a strong Q4 2025, with consolidated operating income projected between $135 million and $145 million, and net income between $131.3 million and $146.3 million. The company expects diluted EPS of $4.22 to $4.70, including a significant tax adjustment benefit, and repurchased 0.7 million shares during the quarter. Matson maintains an optimistic outlook for 2026, forecasting continued strong U.S. consumer demand and a stable Transpacific trading environment.

articles.title: Is Analyst Optimism Revealing the Real Strength of Weyerhaeuser's (WY) Timberland-Centric Model?
articles.description: Analysts have recently reaffirmed positive views on Weyerhaeuser's business model, highlighting its timberland assets, carbon credits, and recreation income, alongside low leverage and portfolio optimization. This optimism, driven by the scarcity of timberland and expected improvement in funds from operations, suggests Weyerhaeuser's diverse model could mitigate sector challenges despite softer lumber demand and housing activity. The company's investment narrative focuses on the long-term value of its timberland and its ability to generate consistent cash flows, with a projected fair value of $29.82.

articles.title: A Look At Welltower (WELL) Valuation As Optimistic Q4 Earnings Expectations Fuel Bullish Analyst Sentiment
articles.description: Welltower (WELL) is approaching its Q4 earnings release with optimistic expectations, including a projected double-digit EPS increase and a history of exceeding profit forecasts. While a common narrative suggests the stock is 9% undervalued with a fair value of $207, its current P/E ratio of 134.9x indicates investors are paying a significant premium compared to industry averages and its own fair ratio, raising questions about valuation risk if growth slows.

articles.title: BlackRock’s IBIT ETF Shatters Expectations with $646.6M Bitcoin Inflow, Signaling Robust Institutional Demand
articles.description: BlackRock's iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) experienced a record-breaking $646.62 million net inflow on January 14, 2025, marking its largest single-day accumulation in three months. This substantial inflow, equivalent to approximately 6,647 BTC, highlights a significant increase in institutional demand for Bitcoin through regulated investment vehicles. The event suggests a potential rebalancing of institutional portfolios and renewed confidence in digital assets, further integrating Bitcoin into traditional finance.

articles.title: ManpowerGroup Stock Upgraded to Outperform by BMO Capital | January 2026 - News and Statistics
articles.description: ManpowerGroup's stock (NYSE:MAN) rose 2.7% after BMO Capital upgraded its rating to Outperform from Market Perform, setting a $44 price target. The upgrade was based on the belief that the staffing sector, despite a broader economic recession not being fully present, had already been in a recession, suggesting an attractive entry point for ManpowerGroup's shares. Despite the positive news, the stock is still trading significantly below its 52-week high, indicating its recent volatility and the market's cautious perception of its long-term recovery.

articles.title: PNC Financial Services Group (PNC) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
articles.description: PNC Financial Services Group (PNC) is set to announce its earnings results this Friday. Analysts anticipate a 6.7% year-on-year revenue growth to $5.97 billion and adjusted earnings of $4.23 per share. The company has a mixed record of meeting revenue estimates and investor sentiment in the diversified banking sector has been stable.

articles.title: CarMax lays off more than 200 employees
articles.description: CarMax announced the layoff of nearly 230 employees, with 113 in the Richmond area, impacting its Home Office and CarMax Auto Finance departments. The company stated the layoffs were a necessary measure to reduce costs and foster a more agile corporate workforce. Affected employees were offered severance, career support, and opportunities to apply for internal positions.

articles.title: Automatic Data Processing (NASDAQ:ADP) Approves Stock Repurchase Program
articles.description: Automatic Data Processing (NASDAQ:ADP) has approved a $6.00 billion share repurchase program, allowing the company to buy back up to 5.8% of its outstanding stock. This move, declared on January 14th, is often seen as a signal that the board believes the stock is undervalued. Additionally, ADP recently raised its quarterly dividend to $1.70 per share, increased its FY2026 earnings per share guidance, and reported strong quarterly results that beat analyst estimates.

articles.title: MATSON ANNOUNCES PRELIMINARY 4Q25 RESULTS, PROVIDES 2026 OUTLOOK AND ANNOUNCES 4Q25 EARNINGS CALL DATE
articles.description: Matson, Inc. announced preliminary fourth-quarter 2025 financial results, forecasting consolidated operating income between $135.0 to $145.0 million and diluted EPS of $4.22 to $4.70, including a $0.77 benefit from income tax adjustments. The company also provided a 2026 outlook expecting consolidated operating income to approach 2025 levels, driven by strong U.S. consumer demand and a stable Transpacific trading environment. Matson will host an earnings call on February 24, 2026, to discuss these results and outlook in more detail.

articles.title: MercadoLibre stock ends higher — here’s what matters before the next session
articles.description: MercadoLibre's stock climbed 1.4% to $2,101.95 after Wednesday's market close, with investors focusing on the company's ability to maintain growth and safeguard margins in online retail and payments. Leadership changes, including a new CEO, are also on watch, while strong Q3 2025 financial results show significant revenue and income growth. Future concerns include rising funding costs, consumer demand in key markets, competition from Amazon and Shopee, and potential risks in its credit portfolio and shipping economics.

articles.title: GLDI: Upside Potential Is Capped
articles.description: The ETRACS Gold Shares Covered Call ETN (GLDI) offers income through call option premiums but limits upside during strong gold rallies. While GLDI achieved nearly a 16% yield, gold itself appreciated 70% in the same period, highlighting the trade-off. The article recommends GLDI only for advanced investors, tactically, and as a small portion of a portfolio, suggesting direct GLD exposure for full upside.

articles.title: Is Realty Income (O) Quietly Redefining Its Risk Profile With GIC Logistics Push Into Mexico?
articles.description: Realty Income (O) recently announced its 667th consecutive monthly dividend and a long-term partnership with GIC, including a US$1.5 billion logistics joint venture and its first industrial investment in Mexico. This expansion into new logistics verticals and geographies, particularly with the US$200 million build-to-suit portfolio in Mexico, is seen as additive rather than transformational, extending its international footprint and private capital initiative. While it offers new opportunities, investors are advised to consider the evolving risk profile and compare various perspectives before making investment decisions.

articles.title: UBS Sees 9%–11% REIT Returns in 2026, Trims Equity LifeStyle (ELS) Price Target
articles.description: UBS projects 9%–11% returns for REITs in 2026, driven by improving macroeconomic conditions, better valuations, easing supply, and a stable political environment. The firm sees 2026 as a two-speed year, with defensive conditions in the first half followed by stronger catalysts in the second half. UBS also trimmed its price target for Equity LifeStyle Properties (ELS) to $67 from $77 but maintained a Buy rating, noting the company's operational performance.

articles.title: How Li Auto’s 1.54 Million 2025 Deliveries Will Impact Li Auto (LI) Investors
articles.description: Li Auto Inc. reported significant delivery figures for December and the full year 2025, totaling 1.54 million vehicles for the year. While these volumes highlight the company's strong execution and demand, the article questions whether high delivery numbers alone can counteract rising costs, pricing pressures, and substantial investments in AI and BEV technology, especially given a recent net loss. Investors are encouraged to consider the interplay between volume, profitability, and future spending to assess the company's investment narrative and fair value.

articles.title: Trump Targets Taiwan, China Supply Chains: President Slaps 25% Tariffs On Nvidia, AMD AI Chips Under National Security Order
articles.description: President Donald Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on select high-end AI chips from companies like Nvidia and AMD, following a nine-month investigation that highlighted U.S. dependence on foreign-made chips as a national security risk. The tariffs are narrowly targeted to encourage domestic chip production and reduce reliance on manufacturing hubs like Taiwan, with exemptions for certain applications. This action follows previous pledges regarding Chinese semiconductor imports and adds complexity to the semiconductor supply chain.

articles.title: Booking Holdings (BKNG) stock slides as visa pause and China probe hit travel shares
articles.description: Booking Holdings (BKNG) stock and other travel shares fell due to shifts in U.S. immigration policy and increased regulatory scrutiny. The travel sector is facing challenges from a new U.S. immigrant visa pause and an antitrust probe by China's market regulator into Trip.com, highlighting policy risks tied to cross-border movement. Despite some resilience, investors are concerned about potential crackdowns on online travel platform fees and market dominance, and the impact of anti-immigration policies on global tourism.

articles.title: Freeport-McMoRan stock near $60 as copper hits records — what traders watch before FCX earnings
articles.description: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) shares rose to $60.35 in after-hours trading, driven by record-high copper prices on the LME. Traders are closely watching the company's Q4 2025 earnings call on January 22nd for guidance on 2026 sales, costs, and demand insights, as recent copper surges have been influenced by trade policy and positioning. While clean energy demand for copper remains strong, there's concern that sustained high prices could curb industrial demand.

articles.title: Woodward Inc. (NASDAQ:WWD) Passes the "Caviar Cruise" Quality Investing Screen
articles.description: Woodward Inc. (NASDAQ:WWD) has successfully passed the "Caviar Cruise" quality investing screen, highlighting its strong financial profile suitable for a buy-and-hold strategy. The company demonstrates excellent profitability, capital efficiency with a ROICexgc of 17.79%, and robust financial health, featuring a low Debt-to-Free Cash Flow ratio of 2.06 and strong "Profit Quality" at 111.07%. Its fundamental analysis further confirms these strengths, particularly in profitability and financial condition, making it an attractive prospect for quality-focused investors despite a potentially high price relative to the broader market.

articles.title: D’Ambrosio, Automatic Data Processing Inc Corp. VP, sells $142k in stock
articles.description: Christopher D’Ambrosio, Corp. VP at Automatic Data Processing Inc (NASDAQ:ADP), sold 543 shares of common stock for $142,423. The transaction, executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan, leaves D’Ambrosio with 9998.23 shares. This news follows ADP's announcement of a new $6 billion share repurchase program and a quarterly dividend, amid positive private sector employment growth reported by ADP's National Employment Report.

articles.title: The Bull Case For Equinix (EQIX) Could Change Following Aggressive Asia-Pacific Data Center Expansion - Learn Why
articles.description: Equinix is expanding its data center footprint in high-growth Asia-Pacific markets, reinforcing its position in AI, cloud, and digital transformation. This expansion, coupled with positive analyst sentiment, could alter its investment narrative as the company navigates significant capital spending and leverage. Investors should consider the funding and execution risks associated with this aggressive growth strategy and its potential impact on long-term outcomes and valuation.

articles.title: CarMax lays off over 230 employees, including 113 in Richmond area
articles.description: CarMax has laid off over 230 employees, including 113 in the Richmond, Virginia area, citing "workforce changes" to reduce costs and operate more efficiently. The company's headquarters are in Goochland County, part of the Richmond region. CarMax is offering severance, career support, and internal reapplication opportunities to affected employees.

articles.title: D’Ambrosio, Automatic Data Processing Inc Corp. VP, sells $142k in stock
articles.description: Christopher D’Ambrosio, a Corporate Vice President at Automatic Data Processing Inc (NASDAQ:ADP), sold 543 shares of common stock for approximately $142,423 on January 13, 2026. This transaction was executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan adopted in September 2025. The company also recently announced a new $6 billion share repurchase program and a quarterly dividend of $1.70 per share, while ADP's National Employment Report indicated a 41,000 increase in U.S. private sector jobs in December.

articles.title: Does Simply Good Foods (SMPL) Buyback Expansion Signal Durable Brand Strength or Limited Growth Options?
articles.description: Simply Good Foods (SMPL) recently reported flat net sales and lower net income for Q1 2026, while expanding its share repurchase authorization to $500 million and reaffirming full-year sales guidance. The company is focusing on product innovation, particularly with its Quest high-protein snack line, to drive growth. The significant buyback, alongside Quest's performance, is central to its investment narrative, though challenges like Atkins' softness and OWYN's integration remain.

articles.title: ManpowerGroup (MAN) Shares Rise: Key Information You Should Be Aware Of
articles.description: ManpowerGroup (NYSE:MAN) saw its stock rise by 3.2% after BMO Capital upgraded its rating to Outperform and set a new price target of $44, citing the staffing industry's recession-like conditions as a potential buying opportunity. Despite this recent increase, the company has experienced significant volatility and disappointing Q1 2025 results due to increased restructuring expenses and higher tax liabilities, leaving its share price well below its 52-week peak. The analyst believes the company's business performance will strengthen, presenting an appealing opportunity for investors.

articles.title: D’Ambrosio, Automatic Data Processing Inc Corp. VP, sells $142k in stock
articles.description: Christopher D’Ambrosio, a Corporate Vice President at Automatic Data Processing Inc (NASDAQ:ADP), sold 543 shares of company stock worth $142,423 on January 13, 2026, under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The sale leaves D’Ambrosio with 9,998.23 shares. This transaction follows other company news, including a new $6 billion share repurchase program and a declared quarterly dividend of $1.70 per share, alongside positive December private sector employment data.

articles.title: AGNC Investment Corp. Elects Dr. Morris Davis to its Board of Directors
articles.description: AGNC Investment Corp. (Nasdaq: AGNC) announced the election of Dr. Morris Davis to its Board of Directors, effective January 12, 2026. Dr. Davis previously served on the board and rejoins after serving as Chief Housing Economist at the Council of Economic Advisors to the President. He will serve as an independent director on the Company’s Compensation and Corporate Governance Committee, bringing extensive expertise in housing policy and economics.

articles.title: Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. Acquires Shares of United Airlines Holdings Inc (NASDAQ:UAL)
articles.description: Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. (D-California) recently purchased between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) stock on December 19th, 2025, as disclosed in a January 12th filing. This insider transaction comes amidst general positive analyst sentiment for UAL, with a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating and a target price of $134.94, despite some near-term risks such as potential Q4 EPS weakness and increased competition. The article also details other recent trades by Rep. Cisneros and provides an overview of United Airlines' stock performance, key headlines, institutional investments, and analyst recommendations.

articles.title: Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. Sells Off Shares of Alexandria Real Estate Equities, Inc. (NYSE:ARE)
articles.description: Representative Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. recently sold shares of Alexandria Real Estate Equities (NYSE:ARE), among other stocks, as part of multiple transactions at the end of 2025. This comes as Alexandria Real Estate Equities faces legal challenges, analyst downgrades, and recently approved a $500 million share buyback while cutting its quarterly dividend. The company's stock has also seen significant institutional investment activity.

articles.title: Kwon David sells ADP stock worth $213k
articles.description: Automatic Data Processing Inc's Corporate Vice President, David Kwon, sold 806 shares of ADP stock for a total of $213,428 on January 12, 2026, under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. This transaction follows ADP's announcement of a new $6 billion share repurchase program and a quarterly dividend of $1.70 per share, alongside positive reports on U.S. private sector employment growth.

articles.title: D’Ambrosio, Automatic Data Processing Inc Corp. VP, sells $142k in stock
articles.description: Christopher D’Ambrosio, a Corporate VP at Automatic Data Processing Inc (NASDAQ:ADP), sold 543 shares of common stock for approximately $142,423 on January 13, 2026. This transaction was conducted under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan and reported to the SEC on January 14, 2026. Following the sale, D'Ambrosio directly owns 9998.23 shares of ADP, which recently announced a new $6 billion share repurchase program and a quarterly dividend of $1.70 per share.

articles.title: US Reportedly Set to Grant Chevron Broader Venezuela Operating License This Week
articles.description: The US is reportedly preparing to grant Chevron Corp a broader operating license in Venezuela as early as this week, marking a significant policy shift. This expanded authorization would give Chevron enhanced operational capabilities and increased flexibility, potentially impacting the US regulatory approach toward American energy companies in Venezuela. The move signals new opportunities for US oil companies in the region amidst ongoing discussions about US energy policy in Latin America.

articles.title: Trading Day: Hard assets hit new highs
articles.description: Rising geopolitical tensions centering on Iran and the U.S. loomed large over world markets on Wednesday, overshadowing strong U.S. retail sales figures to push Wall Street lower, lift oil prices and send gold and other metals prices to new highs.

articles.title: Big-Bang Rise in Nifty Stocks has Metallic Ring to It
articles.description: Producers of base and precious metals in India are making fresh equity highs on the back of an unstoppable run-up in prices of the commodities over the past year.

articles.title: Silver Reaches Record High of $93.44 Per Ounce with Over 7% Surge
articles.description: Spot silver has surged over 7% to reach a record high of $93.44 per ounce, marking a historic milestone in precious metals trading. This significant price movement demonstrates exceptional market strength and represents an all-time high for the commodity, highlighting the current bullish momentum in the precious metals sector.

articles.title: Wall Street Woes Amid Economic Uncertainty and Precious Metals Surge
articles.description: Wall Street indexes fell for a second consecutive day as major banks reported mixed earnings amidst economic and political uncertainty. Investor caution impacted bank and tech stocks despite strong earnings. Precious metals like gold and silver soared, while oil prices rose amid supply concerns and geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: Why gold, silver are smashing records to start 2026 after last year's run
articles.description: The nonstop barrage of news out of Washington in recent weeks — from Venezuela to Iran to Greenland — has added to conviction in the two precious metals.

articles.title: 'Sell America': How Trump Is Fueling Record Gold and Silver Prices in 2026
articles.description: Gold is up 5% and silver is up 25% year-to-date, extending a hot streak for the metals amid the latest policy moves by President Trump.

articles.description: Gold and silver hit record highs as rising tensions drive volatility and margins are raised. Phil Streible breaks down what’s behind the move and the key levels traders are watching in today’s Metals Minute — tune in!

articles.title: Northern Graphite to build $200M Saudi plant with partner

articles.title: Gold Investor, October 2018
articles.description:
Gold Investor, October 2018 Simon Walsworth Thu, 18/10/2018 - 10:54 18 October, 2018

Aram Shishmanian

Ex - CEO World Gold Council

The past two decades have seen a radical shift in the world’s axis, as China has become a dominant global force economically, commercially and, increasingly, politically. In this edition of Gold Investor, we assess the outlook for China across a range of perspectives. 

The past two decades have seen a radical shift in the world’s axis, as China has become a dominant global force economically, commercially and, increasingly, politically.

The figures are remarkable, the pace of change even more so. But there is still enormous potential for future growth.

That potential is widely acknowledged, not least by the Chinese authorities. And they, along with others, recognise that the path to further expansion involves liberalisation, improved regulation and internationalisation.

Initial steps have already been taken but much more action is planned over the coming decade and beyond. This has implications in many areas.

In this edition of Gold Investor, we explore those implications and assess the outlook for China across a range of perspectives.

Professor Zhou, Associate Dean at the world-renowned Tsinghua University PBC School of Finance, considers how best to leverage past lessons as China develops its financial markets in a world characterised by widespread geopolitical tension.

Within China’s financial markets, the insurance industry now manages US$2 trillion (tn) of assets, following a decade of rapid growth. The Insurance Asset Management Association of China explains why this fast-growing sector might benefit from investing some of its US$2tn assets in gold.

We also examine ways in which stronger market infrastructure and improved regulation would boost confidence in China’s gold investment industry, following an in-depth report from one of China’s leading think-tanks, the Financial Research Institute of the Development Research Center of the State Council.

The China Gold Association echoes the need for more robust regulation, suggesting that the mining industry can become a prominent player on the international stage, if it becomes both more disciplined and more outward facing.

The “Belt and Road” initiative has become a symbol of China’s international ambition and its deepening relationship with emerging markets worldwide. Xiao Fu, Head of Commodity Markets’ Strategy at Bank of China International, considers progress to date and the considerable impact that this extensive project will have on the gold market.

Any comprehensive view of China’s gold market would not be complete without an analysis of its jewellery industry, the largest in the world by some margin. Chow Tai Fook, one of country’s most prominent retailers, believes prospects are bright but acknowledges that the industry has to make both structural and strategic changes to attract younger, affluent customers.

I have watched China develop at an extraordinary pace during my years as Chief Executive of the World Gold Council. Today, the focus of the gold market has shifted definitely from West to East with China at the forefront. It is increasingly taking a leadership position worldwide. This is reflected in the increased number of Chinese mining companies that are becoming members of the World Gold Council. To facilitate their active participation on the Board of the Council, we have created the China Chapter which is chaired by Mr Song, the Chairman of China Gold International Resources Corp Ltd and also of the China Gold Association. The China Chapter also provides a platform for China’s leading gold miners and market leaders to guide and engage in our programmes at the highest level.

We are always keen to hear your views about Gold Investor so please email us at goldinvestor@gold.org. We hope you enjoy the read.

Aram Shishmanian

Report Section

articles.title: Gold in the Global Economy: Market, mining and modernisation
articles.description:
Gold in the Global Economy: Market, mining and modernisation Calina Mon, 24/11/2025 - 12:24

Gold has played a fundamental role in society since ancient times. Admired for its beauty and treasured for its economic value, gold’s unique attributes have been recognised for thousands of years.

Today, those attributes continue to define and differentiate gold. Prized by investors, cherished by consumers and deployed in a range of technological applications, gold is an asset like no other, contributing to cultural traditions, financial stability, wealth creation and industrial markets.

In recent years, recognition of gold’s unique characteristics has propelled annual consumption to record levels of almost 5,000 tonnes per annum, fuelled by demand from consumers, investors, central banks and industrial users. Around three-quarters of that demand is satisfied by newly mined gold, yet supply increases by little more than 1.5% annually, providing a favourable long-term backdrop for the market. 

Supply growth is constrained for multiple reasons, not least because gold miners tend to operate in some of the most remote and challenging regions of the world. In spite of these tough operating conditions, responsible miners can make a real difference, contributing approximately US$60 billion annually to host economies, including taxes, employee wages, and payments to local communities and suppliers. 

Nonetheless, producers, refiners and retailers of gold are under scrutiny like never before. Stakeholders are calling for more robust environmental, social and governance (ESG) processes and this has led to sustained and consistent progress. 

This report analyses gold’s role in the global economy – from those who mine and refine it to those who cherish it, invest in it and make use of it. Analysing supply and demand trends across the globe, our report makes three central observations:

  1. Interest in gold is broad, deep and growing, fuelled by demand from sovereign states, investors, savers and consumers.
  2. Gold mining can deliver widespread social, economic and environmental benefits, when supported by advances in technology and new operational models.
  3. Challenges persist across the gold industry, but these present an opportunity to drive change through innovation and ensure that gold is a fit-for-the-future asset.

Evolution in demand 

Economic, social and geopolitical trends have contributed to fundamental shifts in demand for gold. Across the globe, rising tensions and financial market uncertainties are fuelling interest among institutional investors and retail savers, supported by increased ease of access to physical gold and gold-backed funds. Among central banks, there has been sustained gold buying since the Global Financial Crisis, accelerating still further in recent years. In China and India, rising wealth has fostered retail appetite for bars, coins and jewellery, reinforcing gold’s cultural and financial significance across Asia. And in industry, gold’s durability, conductivity and malleability make it a core component of AI infrastructure and other advanced technologies.

Even as demand flows evolve across the globe, the supply chain is also undergoing unprecedented change.

Supply chain in the spotlight

Amid growing calls for tangible evidence of responsible practice along the value chain, gold miners are at the forefront of technological and operational innovations to reduce harmful emissions, drive efficiency, forge stronger partnerships with local communities and root out criminal activity.

Much has been achieved but challenges remain. Gold’s value as a trusted asset does not just depend on its intrinsic qualities but also on how it is produced, refined, sold and stored. Transparency, responsible sourcing and environmental performance have become critical considerations, defining gold’s legitimacy among regulators, responsible investors, lenders and consumers.

This creates a series of challenges for the gold industry, as it strives to deliver ESG change, while responding to a fast-moving regulatory environment.Innovation can provide many of the answers. But industry players are under growing pressure to ensure they are abreast of new developments and can adapt swiftly to stakeholder demands. 

The opportunity is clear: gold that can prove its origin, integrity, and sustainability, will strengthen its position as a credible, resilient asset in a changing financial landscape. The long-term relevance of gold depends not just on being scarce — but on being trusted, transparent, and responsible.

Gold in the Global Economy: Market, mining and modernisation

This report makes four key points:

  1. The value of gold is recognised globally, evidenced by rising and widespread demand.
  2. The gold industry faces growing calls for change.
  3. Key players are already adapting their models and delivering on their obligations, capitalising on 
    technology and cross-industry learnings.
  4. Now the entire industry must follow suit, adopting new processes, exploring new partnerships and driving transparency along the supply chain. 

Gold plays a critical role in socioeconomic growth, financial stability and cultural traditions. Now more than ever, there is an opportunity to ensure gold’s global contribution is understood and appreciated. 

The industry is being called upon to step up and act. Heeding those calls should usher in a new era for gold, built on trust, understanding and confidence in gold’s role as a force for good.

To read more, download the report below:

Gold in the Global Economy: Market, mining and modernisation

articles.title: The social and economic contribution of gold mining – 2025 data update
articles.description:
The social and economic contribution of gold mining – 2025 data update Wilf Walsworth Thu, 09/10/2025 - 11:34

This data update quantifies the direct social and economic contributions of 28 World Gold Council member companies in 2024. The data comprises 220 operational mines and 87 non-producing sites (including head offices) spread across 36 countries. Their impact has been quantified in five main categories:

  • Payments to governments (including taxes and royalties)
  • Payments to suppliers
  • Payments to employees
  • Payments to communities
  • Workforce data (disaggregated by gender and national vs international)

articles.title: Gold, Nature and Biodiversity
articles.description:
Gold, Nature and Biodiversity Brandon Marsh Mon, 22/09/2025 - 13:15
Nature, climate, and society are deeply interlinked, and understanding interconnected environmental and social impacts requires a more holistic and integrated approach.

Nature, climate, and society are intricately interconnected, and addressing their interdependencies demands a more integrated and holistic approach to sustainability-focused research and planning.

Recognising this imperative, the World Gold Council is broadening its analytical lens—moving beyond its established focus on climate change to encompass the nature-related risks and biodiversity impacts associated with gold mining. This evolution reflects a growing understanding that climate stability and social development cannot be achieved without safeguarding ecosystems and the services they provide.

In our new report, Gold, Nature and Biodiversity: An Introduction, we apply the Nature Risk Profile methodology—developed by S&P Global Sustainable1 (our research partners) and UNEP-WCMC—to a sample of 122 gold mines across multiple continents and biomes. This framework, aligned with TNFD’s LEAP approach, enables standardised comparisons of ecological impacts and dependencies across diverse site and geographies.

While the majority of gold mine sites were, perhaps surprisingly, found to exhibit relatively low ecosystem impact, a subset of mines—including those overlapping with protected or ecologically significant areas—were flagged as being of higher impact or significance. Closer examination of the local implications of these findings underscores the importance of targeted risk management and the need to understand nature’s contribution not only to biodiversity but also to local communities.

Importantly, complementing high-level analysis with site-level insights and an examination of company disclosures, reveals a range of practical responses and adaptive strategies that may not be evident from top-down metrics. These localised perspectives help illuminate what ‘good practice’ looks like in real-world contexts and offer a firm foundation for more coherent understanding of gold industry’s nature-related impacts.

We regard this work as a further step toward a more cohesive and integrated sustainability research agenda and hope it will further encourage meaningful industry initiatives to enhance the health and resilience of the ecosystems surrounding gold mining operations.

Gold, Nature and Biodiversity: An Introduction

Our research on Gold, Nature and Biodiversity combines the following: 

  • An application of the Nature Risk Profile methodology (developed by S&P Global and UNEP) to 122 different gold mine sites of different types (approximately 60% open pit, 40% underground), located across 6 continents, in a range of ecosystems and biomes.
  • An examination, referencing the impact metrics from the above analysis, of 15 local mine site-level responses, plans and projects seeking to contribute to risk mitigation, and positive improvement in biodiversity and ecosystem services.
  • A consideration of the implications and main drivers of progress for the wider gold mining sector, including how disclosures are positioned and received by industry stakeholders and analysts.

To read more, download the report below:

Gold, Nature and Biodiversity: An Introduction - Summary
PDF 0.59 mb
Gold, Nature and Biodiversity: An Introduction - Full Report

articles.title: A New Golden Age: Imagining The Future of Digital Gold
articles.description:
A New Golden Age: Imagining The Future of Digital Gold Calina Thu, 18/09/2025 - 16:39

During a turbulent 2025, the stock of gold has risen both figuratively and literally. The World Gold Council’s Mid-Year Outlook for 2025 captures its record-breaking trajectory; gold has risen by 26% in US dollar terms between January and June, while reaching double-digit returns across all major currencies.

The value of gold as an asset has never been clearer,  yet the gold industry finds itself at a fascinating crossroads. The advent of new technologies, including blockchain, decentralised finance (DeFi) and cryptocurrency is having a transformational effect on the financial markets that gold operates in. A new age of easily accessible, yield-bearing digital assets puts traditional assets under the spotlight, potentially disrupting their financial status. But at the same time, these innovations create previously unimaginable opportunities for gold to thrive as the ultimate physical and digital asset.

The results could be game-changing for the gold industry, increasing trust in gold markets, and recreating the metal as a fungible and highly liquid digital asset capable of powering the financial markets of the future. Our "gold" paper creates a vision of how digitalisation could re-orientate the gold industry in the years ahead. With insight from a dozen leaders and innovators from within the gold industry and across the fields of finance, blockchain and real-world asset (RWA) tokenisation, alongside our experts at The Future Laboratory, we explore the potential future use cases for digital gold. 

The report outlines three broad territories that we believe hold exciting potential, each of which includes four ‘what if...’ scenarios that show what could be possible in future.

Read More
